definition: to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale
(onom.) sound of singing, cheering etc/(phonetic)/(dialect) to chat
sentence-final particle, contraction of 了啊, indicating exclamation/particle placed after each item in a list of examples
circle/ring/loop/classifier for loops, orbits, laps of race etc/CL:個|个[ge4]/to surround/to circle
to confine/to lock up/to pen in

sentences.english: Grasp the hoop lightly in your right hand, palm facing down.
sentences.chinese: 右手輕輕抓住呼啦圈，掌心朝下。

sentences.english: Begin swinging the hoop clockwise so the hoop is parallel to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 開始順時針擺動呼啦圈，讓它與地面平行。

sentences.english: New Fitness Trends Include Zumba, Belly Dancing and Hula Hooping.
sentences.chinese: 新的健身趨勢包括尊巴，肚皮舞和呼啦圈運動。

sentences.english: The booty bump hula hoop trick involves bending over and getting the hoop to spin vertically.
sentences.chinese: 呼啦圈的戰利品凸點伎倆涉及彎腰和得到垂直旋轉箍。
呼啦圈，仰臥起坐，俯臥撐。

sentences.english: Continue to circle the hoop, passing it from one hand to the other.
sentences.chinese: 繼續轉動呼啦圈，在兩手之間交替。

sentences.english: But the company that made them was not able to get a patent for such an ancient idea.
sentences.chinese: 但是製造呼啦圈的公司並不能爲這一古老創想專利。

sentences.english: The new hula hoop is made with high technology.
sentences.chinese: 新的呼啦圈是由高科技。

sentences.english: The world around his neck hula longest diameter circle is Mr. Yu Xihe. Verified in London on 5 December 2013.
sentences.chinese: 世界上脖子轉呼啦圈內直徑最長的人是俞喜鶴先生。
